purpose: Discover hidden gem GitHub repositories using AI-powered analysis

what_it_does.simple_explanation: GitRecombo finds unknown but high-quality GitHub repositories that could be game-changers for your project. Instead of just looking at star counts, it analyzes repository health, novelty, author reputation, and semantic relevance to discover hidden gems.
what_it_does.key_difference: Most tools recommend popular (starred) repos. GitRecombo finds UNDERVALUED repos with <100 stars that have exceptional quality metrics but haven't been discovered yet.
workflow: 2. GitRecombo searches GitHub for recent repos matching those topics
3. Analyzes each repo with multiple scoring algorithms:
- Novelty score: How fresh/active is it? (exponential decay formula)
- Health score: Has tests? CI/CD? Good docs? Active commits?
- Relevance score: Semantic similarity to user's goal (using embeddings)
4. Combines scores into gem_score using weighted formula
5. Returns top 6 hidden gems with architectural blueprint for integration

ultra_autonomous.py.role: Main entry point - orchestrates the entire discovery process
ultra_autonomous.py.inputs: Configuration JSON file with topics, parameters, weights
ultra_autonomous.py.outputs: Mission JSON with discovered repos and architectural blueprint

discover.py.role: Discovery engine - GitHub API interactions and scoring algorithms

key_functions.health_score(): Analyze repo quality (CI, tests, releases, manifest)

api_calls: GitHub REST API - code search (for tests/CI detection)
GitHub REST API - user info (for author reputation)

embeddings.py.role: Semantic analysis - converts text to vector embeddings
embeddings.py.why_embeddings: Enables semantic similarity matching - finds repos conceptually related to user's goal, not just keyword matches

llm.py.role: LLM integration - generates project recombination blueprints
llm.py.purpose: Takes discovered repos and creates actionable integration plan with code examples

github_search_planner.py.role: Rate limit manager - prevents GitHub API throttling
key_features: Tracks API usage per endpoint (search, code_search, rest)

repo_cache.py.role: Caching layer - stores README content and processed repo markers
benefits: Tracks already-processed repos to avoid duplicates

required_fields.days: Number of days to look back for repo activity
required_fields.max: Maximum repos to return per query

optional_fields.explore_longtail: Boolean - focus on repos with <100 stars (hidden gems mode)
optional_fields.max_stars: Integer - upper limit for star count (for longtail discovery)
optional_fields.probe_limit: Integer - how many repos to analyze deeply

gem_score.formula: gem_score = (w_novelty × novelty) + (w_health × health) + (w_relevance × relevance) + (w_author × author_rep) + (w_diversity × diversity_bonus)

factors: Penalty if repo is itself a fork

components.has_tests: Presence of test files or test directory
components.has_manifest: Has package manifest (pyproject.toml, package.json, Cargo.toml, go.mod)

relevance_score.method: Cosine similarity between repository text and user's goal

cli_options.--clear-processed: Ignore cache of previously processed repos
cli_options.--no-cache: Don't use cached README content (force fresh GitHub fetches)
cli_options.--search-only: Only search, don't generate recombination blueprint

structure.title: Mission title
why_it_works: Explanation of why these repos work together

openai_api_key.optional_if: use_embeddings=true with embed_provider='sbert' and search-only mode

typical_use_cases: Find cutting-edge ML frameworks before they go viral
Discover innovative database solutions with <50 stars

solutions: Wait for rate limit reset (check X-RateLimit-Reset header)
Reduce probe_limit to analyze fewer repos

no_results.symptom: Empty or very few repos returned

embedding_errors.symptom: Model download fails or embedding errors
solutions: Ensure sentence-transformers is installed: pip install sentence-transformers
Check disk space (~1.3GB for model download)
